ground_truth: All the boys are fast asleep except for Harry. He is sitting in his pajamas on the wide-stone sill gazing out of the window with his knees tucked up under his chin. Sitting beside him, his pet snowy owl turns its head as he gently strokes its soft, white feathers. As Harry looks out through the diamond shaped window panes across the moonlit courtyard at the school, he gives a contented smile. Next morning, Harry and Ron are late for class. A tabby cat is sitting on the teacher's desk. It looks up as they open the classroom door. Hermione looks at them disapprovingly as they hurry into the room. The cat leaps off of the table and turns into Professor McGonagall. Later, the dark figure of Professor Snape sweeps into his classroom. He fixes his eyes on Malfoy who smiles slyly. Harry takes careful notes. Snape spots him. Hermione nudges Harry. He puts his quill back in the inkwell. Hermione holds up her hand. Hermione knows. Hermione is desperate to answer. The great hall. Seamus peers into a goblet. Seamus' face is smudged with soot. Owls carrying mail flutter in through a high window. A parcel is dropped to one of the children below. The graceful birds swoop amongst the carved oak beams and fly from one end of the great hall to the other, delivering letters and parcels to their delighted owners. Ron has received a newspaper and some letters. He puts the newspaper to one side. Harry picks it up. Neville unwraps a small glass ball. It turns red. Hermione looks at them both with narrowed eyes. In the school grounds, a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides across the lawn. Harry's broom leaps straight into his hand. Malfoy catches his broomstick. The others keep trying. Ron's broom flies up and smacks him on the nose. Neville's broomstick lifts him into the air. Terrified he rises even higher. The broom carries him higher above their heads. He hangs on for dear life. The broom swings him round in circles and crashes into the side of a stone tower. It spins away just to turn again then dives towards the ground. Madam Hooch takes out her hound. The children scatter. The broomstick carries Neville, and zooms up over the statues on the battlements. His cloth gets caught on the sword and he drops the broomstick. The cloak rips and gives way. He plummets down and crashes heavily to the ground. Her cloak flying, Madam Hooch runs across to Neville and gently lifts him up. Malfoy finds the Remembrall. Malfoy mounts his broom. He flies on top of their heads. Harry steps astride his broomstick. Harry zooms after Malfoy.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: All the lads are quick asleep except for Harry. He is sitting in his nightclothes on the broad-stone ledge staring out of the casement with his knees tucked up under his chin. Sitting beside him, his pet snowy owl turns its head as he gently caresses its soft, white plumage. As Harry looks out through the diamond-shaped windowpanes across the moonlit courtyard at the academy, he gives a satisfied smile. Next morning, Harry and Ron are tardy for class. A tabby feline is sitting on the instructor's desk. It looks up as they open the classroom portal. Hermione gazes at them disapprovingly as they dash into the chamber. The cat leaps off of the table and transforms into Professor McGonagall. Later, the dark silhouette of Professor Snape glides into his classroom. He fixes his gaze on Malfoy who grins slyly. Harry takes meticulous notes. Snape spots him. Hermione nudges Harry. He puts his quill back in the inkwell. Hermione raises her hand. Hermione knows. Hermione is eager to reply. The grand hall. Seamus peers into a chalice. Seamus' visage is smeared with soot. Owls carrying mail flutter in through a lofty window. A packet is dropped to one of the youngsters below. The elegant birds swoop amongst the sculpted oak beams and fly from one end of the grand hall to the other, delivering letters and packages to their thrilled owners. Ron has received a gazette and some letters. He puts the gazette to one side. Harry picks it up. Neville unwraps a small glass orb. It turns crimson. Hermione gazes at them both with narrowed eyes. In the academy grounds, a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides across the lawn. Harry's broom leaps straight into his hand. Malfoy grasps his broomstick. The others keep trying. Ron's broom flies up and smacks him on the nose. Neville's broomstick lifts him into the sky. Terrified he rises even higher. The broom carries him elevated above their heads. He clings on for dear life. The broom swings him round in circles and crashes into the side of a stone tower. It spins away just to turn again then dives towards the ground. Madam Hooch takes out her dog. The children scatter. The broomstick carries Neville, and zooms up over the statues on the battlements. His cloth gets caught on the sword and he drops the broomstick. The cloak tears and gives way. He plummets down and crashes heavily to the earth. Her cloak flying, Madam Hooch runs across to Neville and gently lifts him up. Malfoy finds the Remembrall. Malfoy mounts his broom. He flies on top of their heads. Harry steps astride his broomstick. Harry zooms after Malfoy.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: All the boys are asleep except Harry, who sits in pajamas on the wide stone sill, gazing out the window with his knees tucked under his chin. His pet snowy owl turns its head as he gently strokes its soft feathers. Harry smiles contentedly, looking through the diamond-shaped window panes at the moonlit school courtyard. The next morning, Harry and Ron are late for class. A tabby cat on the teacher's desk looks up as they enter. Hermione disapproves as they hurry in. The cat leaps off the table, transforming into Professor McGonagall. Later, Professor Snape enters his classroom, eyes fixed on Malfoy, who smiles slyly. Harry takes notes, but Snape notices. Hermione nudges Harry, who puts his quill back. Hermione raises her hand, eager to answer. In the great hall, Seamus peers into a goblet, his face smudged with soot. Owls deliver mail through a high window, dropping parcels to children below. The birds swoop among the carved oak beams, delivering letters and parcels. Ron receives a newspaper and letters, setting the paper aside. Harry picks it up. Neville unwraps a small glass ball that turns red. Hermione narrows her eyes at them. Outside, a woman with spiky silver hair strides across the lawn. Harry's broom leaps into his hand. Malfoy catches his broomstick, while others struggle. Ron's broom hits his nose. Neville's broom lifts him into the air, carrying him higher. He clings on as it swings him in circles, crashing into a stone tower, then dives toward the ground. Madam Hooch takes out her hound, scattering the children. Neville's broom zooms over battlements, his cloak caught on a sword. The cloak rips, and he crashes to the ground. Madam Hooch runs to Neville, lifting him gently. Malfoy finds the Remembrall, mounts his broom, and flies overhead. Harry mounts his broomstick and zooms after Malfoy.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: All boys sleep but Harry, who sits in pajamas on the wide stone sill, knees tucked up, gazing out the diamond-paned window. His snowy owl beside him turns her head as he gently strokes her soft feathers. Smiling, Harry watches the moonlit school courtyard. Next morning, Harry and Ron arrive late. A tabby cat on the teacher's desk looks up as they enter. Hermione frowns. The cat jumps down, turning into Professor McGonagall. Later, Professor Snape enters, fixes on Malfoy, who grins. Harry takes notes. Snape sees him. Hermione nudges Harry, who lowers his quill. She raises her hand, eager to answer. In the great hall, Seamus, face sooty, peers into a goblet. Owls bring mail, gliding through beams, dropping parcels to delighted children. Ron gets letters and a newspaper, which Harry picks up. Neville unwraps a red-glowing glass ball. Hermione eyes them both suspiciously. Outside, a silver-haired woman crosses the lawn. Harry’s broom leaps into his hand. Malfoy catches his. Others struggle. Ron’s broom hits his nose. Neville’s broom lifts him, rising higher. He clings on, spinning, crashing into a tower, diving, flying over battlements. His cloak snags on a sword, rips, and he falls hard. Madam Hooch runs to lift him. Malfoy finds the Remembrall, mounts his broom, and flies above. Harry mounts his and zooms after him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
All the boys in the dormitory are fast asleep, nestled comfortably in their beds, except for Harry. He is sitting quietly in his pajamas on the wide, stone window sill, gazing thoughtfully out of the window with his knees tucked up snugly under his chin. Sitting beside him, his pet snowy owl, with its striking white feathers, turns its head as he gently strokes its soft, downy plumage. As Harry looks out through the diamond-shaped window panes, his eyes wander across the moonlit courtyard of the school, and he gives a contented smile, feeling a sense of peace. 

The next morning, Harry and Ron find themselves running late for class. As they hurriedly open the classroom door, a tabby cat is sitting on the teacher's desk, its eyes following their entrance. Hermione, sitting nearby, looks at them with a disapproving expression as they rush into the room. Suddenly, the cat leaps gracefully off the table and transforms into Professor McGonagall, much to their surprise. Later on, the dark, imposing figure of Professor Snape sweeps dramatically into his classroom. He fixes his intense gaze on Malfoy, who responds with a sly, knowing smile. Harry, meanwhile, is diligently taking careful notes. Snape's sharp eyes spot him, and Hermione, sitting beside Harry, nudges him gently. He quickly puts his quill back in the inkwell. Hermione, eager to participate, holds up her hand, desperate to answer the question.

In the great hall, Seamus peers curiously into a goblet, his face smudged with soot from a recent mishap. Owls, carrying mail, flutter in through a high window, their wings flapping gracefully. A parcel is dropped to one of the children below, causing a stir of excitement. The graceful birds swoop elegantly amongst the carved oak beams, flying from one end of the great hall to the other, delivering letters and parcels to their delighted owners. Ron has received a newspaper and some letters, which he puts to one side. Harry, intrigued, picks up the newspaper. Meanwhile, Neville unwraps a small glass ball, which turns red, indicating something forgotten. Hermione looks at them both with narrowed eyes, her curiosity piqued.

Out in the school grounds, a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides purposefully across the lawn. Harry's broom, as if sensing his presence, leaps straight into his hand. Malfoy, with a smirk, catches his broomstick effortlessly. The others keep trying, with varying degrees of success. Ron's broom, however, flies up unexpectedly and smacks him on the nose. Neville's broomstick, on the other hand, lifts him into the air, and terrified, he rises even higher. The broom carries him higher above their heads, and he hangs on for dear life. The broom swings him around in circles and crashes into the side of a stone tower. It spins away, only to turn again, then dives towards the ground. Madam Hooch, seeing the commotion, takes out her wand. The children scatter in all directions. The broomstick, still carrying Neville, zooms up over the statues on the battlements. His cloak gets caught on the sword, and he drops the broomstick. The cloak rips and gives way, and he plummets down, crashing heavily to the ground. Her cloak flying behind her, Madam Hooch runs swiftly across to Neville and gently lifts him up, checking for injuries. Meanwhile, Malfoy finds the Remembrall and, with a mischievous grin, mounts his broom. He flies on top of their heads, taunting them. Harry, determined, steps astride his broomstick and zooms after Malfoy, ready to confront him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
All the boys residing within the cozy confines of the dormitory are soundly asleep, nestled snugly and comfortably in their beds, with the exception of Harry. He is sitting quietly, clad in his pajamas, perched on the wide, stone window sill. His gaze is thoughtfully directed out of the window, with his knees tucked up snugly under his chin. Seated beside him is his faithful pet snowy owl, notable for its striking white feathers. The owl turns its head as Harry gently strokes its soft, downy plumage. As Harry peers out through the diamond-shaped window panes, his eyes wander across the moonlit courtyard of the school, and, feeling a sense of peace, he allows a contented smile to spread across his face.

The following morning, Harry and Ron find themselves in a bit of a rush, running slightly late for class. As they hurriedly push open the classroom door, they notice a tabby cat sitting authoritatively on the teacher's desk, its eyes following them as they make their entrance. Hermione, seated nearby, casts a disapproving look in their direction as they hustle into the room. Suddenly, the cat, with a graceful leap, jumps off the table and astonishingly transforms into Professor McGonagall, to their utter amazement. Later in the day, the dark, foreboding figure of Professor Snape sweeps dramatically into his classroom. He fixes his intense, penetrating gaze on Malfoy, who responds with a sly, knowing smile. Harry, meanwhile, is diligently taking careful notes. Snape's sharp, observant eyes catch sight of him, and Hermione, sitting beside Harry, nudges him gently. He quickly puts his quill back into the inkwell. Hermione, eager and keen to participate, holds up her hand, desperate to provide the answer to the question.

In the grand and bustling great hall, Seamus peers curiously into a goblet, his face smudged with soot from a recent mishap. Owls, carrying mail, flutter in gracefully through a high window, their wings flapping with elegance. A parcel is dropped to one of the children below, causing a stir of excitement and commotion. The graceful birds swoop elegantly amongst the ornately carved oak beams, flying from one end of the great hall to the other, as they deliver letters and parcels to their delighted owners. Ron receives a newspaper and some letters, which he places to one side. Harry, intrigued and curious, picks up the newspaper. Meanwhile, Neville unwraps a small glass ball, which immediately turns red, signifying that something has been forgotten. Hermione looks at them both with narrowed eyes, her curiosity piqued by the unfolding events.

Out in the expansive school grounds, a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides purposefully across the green lawn. Harry's broom, as if sensing his presence, leaps straight into his hand with remarkable ease. Malfoy, with a confident smirk, effortlessly catches his own broomstick. The others continue trying, with varying degrees of success. Ron's broom, however, unexpectedly flies up and smacks him right on the nose. Neville's broomstick, on the other hand, lifts him into the air quite suddenly, and terrified, he rises even higher. The broom carries him higher above their heads, and he clings on for dear life. The broom swings him around in dizzying circles and crashes into the side of a stone tower. It spins away, only to veer again, then dives towards the ground. Madam Hooch, witnessing the commotion, takes out her wand. Chaos ensues as the children scatter in all directions. The broomstick, still carrying Neville, zooms up over the statues on the battlements. His cloak becomes entangled on the sword, and he drops the broomstick altogether. The fabric of the cloak rips and gives way, and he careens down, crashing heavily to the ground. Her cloak flying behind her, Madam Hooch runs swiftly across to Neville and gently lifts him up, carefully checking for any injuries. Meanwhile, Malfoy finds the Remembrall and, with a mischievous grin, mounts his broom. He flies above their heads, taunting them from above. Harry, determined and resolute, steps astride his broomstick and zooms after Malfoy, ready to confront him in a daring pursuit.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: All the boys are nestled in their beds, fast asleep, except for Harry, who remains awake. He sits comfortably in his pajamas on the wide-stone window sill, his knees drawn up under his chin, as he gazes thoughtfully out of the window. Beside him, his pet snowy owl perches quietly, turning its head to look at him as he gently strokes its soft, white feathers with a tender hand. Harry's eyes drift through the diamond-shaped window panes, taking in the serene view of the moonlit courtyard at the school, and a contented smile spreads across his face. The next morning, Harry and Ron find themselves running late for class. As they hurriedly open the classroom door, a tabby cat sitting on the teacher's desk looks up at them with a curious gaze. Hermione, already seated, casts a disapproving look in their direction as they rush into the room. Suddenly, the cat leaps gracefully off the table and, in a swift transformation, turns into Professor McGonagall. Later, the dark, imposing figure of Professor Snape sweeps into his classroom with an air of authority. His eyes fixate on Malfoy, who responds with a sly smile. Meanwhile, Harry diligently takes careful notes, but Snape's sharp gaze catches him in the act. Hermione, sitting nearby, nudges Harry to get his attention, prompting him to put his quill back into the inkwell. Eager to participate, Hermione raises her hand, clearly knowing the answer and desperate to share it. In the great hall, Seamus peers intently into a goblet, his face smudged with soot from some earlier mishap. Suddenly, a flurry of owls carrying mail flutters in through a high window, creating a spectacle as they swoop gracefully among the carved oak beams. They fly from one end of the great hall to the other, delivering letters and parcels to their delighted owners below. Ron receives a newspaper and some letters, casually setting the newspaper aside, which Harry promptly picks up. Nearby, Neville unwraps a small glass ball that turns red, catching Hermione's attention as she looks at them both with narrowed eyes. Outside in the school grounds, a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides purposefully across the lawn. In a display of magical prowess, Harry's broom leaps straight into his hand, while Malfoy catches his broomstick with ease. The other students continue trying to summon their brooms, with varying degrees of success. Ron's broom, however, flies up unexpectedly and smacks him on the nose, while Neville's broomstick lifts him into the air, leaving him terrified as he rises even higher. The broom carries him above their heads, and he clings on for dear life as it swings him around in circles, eventually crashing into the side of a stone tower. The broom spins away, only to turn again and dive towards the ground. Madam Hooch, observing the chaos, takes out her hound, causing the children to scatter in all directions. Meanwhile, Neville's broomstick, still carrying him, zooms up over the statues on the battlements. His cloak gets caught on a sword, and he drops the broomstick as the fabric rips and gives way, sending him plummeting down to crash heavily on the ground. With her cloak flying behind her, Madam Hooch runs swiftly across to Neville and gently lifts him up, ensuring he is okay. Meanwhile, Malfoy finds the Remembrall and, with a mischievous grin, mounts his broom. He flies above the heads of the other students, taunting them from above. Determined, Harry steps astride his broomstick and zooms after Malfoy, ready to confront him.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
All the boys are fast asleep except for Harry, who sits in his pajamas on the wide stone sill, gazing out the window with his knees tucked under his chin. Beside him, his pet snowy owl turns its head as he gently strokes its soft feathers. Harry smiles contentedly as he looks through the diamond-shaped window panes at the moonlit school courtyard. 

The next morning, Harry and Ron rush into class late, drawing a disapproving look from Hermione. A tabby cat on the teacher's desk transforms into Professor McGonagall as they enter. Later, in Professor Snape's classroom, Snape's gaze fixes on Malfoy, who smiles slyly, while Harry takes notes. Hermione nudges Harry to stop writing and raises her hand eagerly, knowing the answer.

In the great hall, Seamus peers into a goblet, his face smudged with soot, as owls deliver mail. A parcel drops to a child below, and the birds swoop gracefully among the carved oak beams. Ron receives a newspaper and letters, setting the newspaper aside, which Harry picks up. Neville unwraps a small glass ball that turns red, prompting Hermione to look at them with narrowed eyes.

Outside, a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides across the school grounds. Harry's broom leaps into his hand, while Malfoy catches his broomstick. The others struggle, with Ron's broom smacking him on the nose and Neville's broomstick lifting him into the air. Terrified, Neville rises higher, clinging on as the broom swings him in circles and crashes into a stone tower. It spins away, then dives toward the ground. Madam Hooch rushes to Neville as he plummets and crashes to the ground, gently lifting him up. Meanwhile, Malfoy finds the Remembrall, mounts his broom, and flies overhead. Harry quickly mounts his broomstick and zooms after Malfoy.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: All the boys are fast asleep except for Harry. He, a student at the renowned Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, is sitting in his pajamas on the wide-stone sill gazing out of the window with his knees tucked up under his chin. Sitting beside him, his pet snowy owl, known as Hedwig and a common companion for wizards to deliver messages, turns its head as he gently strokes its soft, white feathers. As Harry looks out through the diamond-shaped window panes across the moonlit courtyard at the school, a centuries-old castle with towering spires and expansive grounds, he gives a contented smile. Next morning, Harry and Ron are late for class. A tabby cat is sitting on the teacher's desk, which is typical of Transfiguration classes. It looks up as they open the classroom door. Hermione, known for her intelligence and dedication to her studies, looks at them disapprovingly as they hurry into the room. The cat leaps off of the table and turns into Professor McGonagall, the stern but fair Transfiguration teacher and Deputy Headmistress. Later, the dark figure of Professor Snape, the enigmatic Potions Master known for his mysterious past, sweeps into his classroom. He fixes his eyes on Malfoy, the cunning Slytherin student, who smiles slyly. Harry takes careful notes. Snape spots him. Hermione nudges Harry, who is renowned for his adventurous spirit. He puts his quill back in the inkwell. Hermione holds up her hand, eager as always to participate in class discussions. Hermione knows. Hermione is desperate to answer. The great hall, a vast dining area with an enchanted ceiling that reflects the sky outside, bustles with students. Seamus peers into a goblet. Seamus’ face is smudged with soot, a common mishap due to his tendency for accidental explosions in spells. Owls carrying mail flutter in through a high window, a daily tradition at Hogwarts during breakfast. A parcel is dropped to one of the children below. The graceful birds swoop amongst the carved oak beams and fly from one end of the great hall to the other, delivering letters and parcels to their delighted owners. Ron has received a newspaper and some letters, a usual occurrence in the wizarding world that keeps students informed of magical news. He puts the newspaper to one side. Harry picks it up, always curious about events in the wizarding community. Neville unwraps a small glass ball. It turns red, indicating he has forgotten something, as it's a Remembrall, a magical object that assists with memory. Hermione looks at them both with narrowed eyes. In the school grounds, a neat woman with spiky silver hair, Madam Hooch the flying instructor, strides across the lawn. Harry's broom leaps straight into his hand, a skillful maneuver that hints at his natural talent for flying. Malfoy catches his broomstick. The others keep trying. Ron's broom flies up and smacks him on the nose, highlighting his struggles with magical equipment. Neville's broomstick lifts him into the air. Terrified he rises even higher, indicative of the unpredictability of magical brooms for beginners. The broom carries him higher above their heads. He hangs on for dear life. The broom swings him round in circles and crashes into the side of a stone tower, which forms part of the ancient castle with abundant history. It spins away just to turn again then dives towards the ground. Madam Hooch takes out her wand, ready to intervene in the situation. The children scatter. The broomstick carries Neville, and zooms up over the statues on the battlements, symbolic stone figures that overlook the grounds. His cloth gets caught on the sword and he drops the broomstick. The cloak rips and gives way. He plummets down and crashes heavily to the ground. Her cloak flying, Madam Hooch, who is responsible for teaching the students how to fly, runs across to Neville and gently lifts him up. Malfoy finds the Remembrall, which Neville had dropped in his fall. Malfoy mounts his broom. He flies on top of their heads, showing off with his flying skills. Harry steps astride his broomstick, ready to chase, as his natural affinity for flying drives him to pursue Malfoy. Harry zooms after Malfoy.

Seamus peers into a goblet. Seamus' face is smudged with soot. Owls carrying mail flutter in through a high window. A parcel is dropped to one of the children below. The graceful birds swoop amongst the carved oak beams and fly from one end of the great hall to the other delivering letters and parcels to their delighted owners. Ron has received a newspaper and some letters. He puts the newspaper to one side. Harry picks it up. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. Neville unwraps a small glass ball. It turns red. Hermione looks at them both with narrowed eyes. In the school grounds a neat woman with spiky silver hair strides across the lawn. Harry's broom leaps straight into his hand. Malfoy catches his broomstick. The others keep trying. Ron's broom flies up and smacks him on the nose. Neville's broomstick lifts him into the air. Terrified he rises even higher. The broom carries him higher above their heads. He hangs on for dear life. The broom swings him round in circles and crashes into the side of a stone tower. It spins away just to turn again then dives towards the ground. Madam Hooch takes out her hound. The children scatter. The broomstick carries Neville and zooms up over the statues on the battlements. His cloth gets caught on the sword and he drops the broomstick. The cloak rips and gives way. He plummets down and crashes heavily to the ground. Her cloak flying. Madam Hooch runs across to Neville and gently lifts him up. Malfoy finds the Remembrall. Malfoy mounts his broom. He flies on top of their heads. Harry steps astride his broomstick. Harry zooms after Malfoy.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: All the boys are fast asleep except for Harry. He is reclining in his pajamas on the wide-stone sill peering out of the window with his knees pressed against his chest. Sitting beside him, his pet snowy owl swivels its head as he carefully brushes its soft, white feathers. As Harry glances out through the diamond shaped window panes across the moonlit courtyard at the school, he breaks into a satisfied smile. Next morning, Harry and Ron are behind schedule for class. A tabby cat is lounging on the teacher's desk. It glances up as they swing open the classroom door. Hermione frowns at them as they dash into the room. The cat hops off of the table and morphs into Professor McGonagall. Later, the shadowy figure of Professor Snape glides into his classroom. He locks his eyes on Malfoy who smirks cunningly. Harry scribbles meticulous notes. Snape notices him. Hermione elbows Harry. He dips his quill into the inkwell. Hermione raises her hand. Hermione understands. Hermione is eager to respond. The great hall. Seamus inspects a goblet. Seamus' face is smeared with soot. Owls carrying mail drift in through a high window. A parcel is lowered to one of the children below. The graceful birds dart amongst the carved oak beams and soar from one end of the great hall to the other, distributing letters and parcels to their thrilled owners. Ron has obtained a newspaper and some letters. He sets the newspaper aside. Harry grabs it. Neville unveils a small glass ball. It glows red. Hermione observes them both with narrowed eyes. In the school grounds, a tidy woman with spiky silver hair marches across the lawn. Harry's broom jumps directly into his hand. Malfoy catches his broomstick. The others persistently attempt. Ron's broom springs upwards and taps him on the nose. Neville's broomstick hoists him into the air. Alarmed, he ascends even higher. The broom elevates him above their heads. He clings on desperately. The broom twirls him around in circles and slams into the side of a stone tower. It twirls away just to pivot again then plummets towards the ground. Madam Hooch withdraws her hound. The children disperse. The broomstick hoists Neville, and propels up over the statues on the battlements. His cloth gets entangled on the sword and he loses grip of the broomstick. The cloak tears and gives way. He falls and lands heavily on the ground. Her cloak trailing, Madam Hooch dashes across to Neville and gently raises him up. Malfoy discovers the Remembrall. Malfoy hops onto his broom. He floats above their heads. Harry leaps astride his broomstick. Harry dashes after Malfoy.

Ron has received a magazine and some notes. He pushes the magazine to one side. Harry picks it up. Neville unwraps a small ceramic sphere. It glows blue. Hermione eyes them both with narrowed eyes. In the school grounds, a tidy man with slick gold hair marches across the field. Harry's broom hops directly into his hand. Malfoy snags his kite. The others keep attempting. Ron's broom flies up and bops him on the forehead. Neville's kite lifts him into the sky. Terrified, he rises even higher. The kite hoists him above their heads. He clings for dear life. The kite swings him round in loops and smacks into the side of a brick tower. It twirls away just to veer again and then plunges towards the earth. Madam Hooch retrieves her umbrella. The children scatter. The kite scoops Neville, and zips up over the gargoyles on the turrets. His cloak gets snagged on the flagpole and he drops the kite. The curtain tears and gives way. He tumbles down and crashes heavily to the earth. Her shawl flapping, Madam Hooch dashes over to Neville and gently lifts him up. Malfoy finds the Remembrall. Malfoy climbs his horse. He gallops above their heads. Harry mounts his unicycle. Harry races after Malfoy.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: All the owls are quietly chirping except for Steven. He is lounging in his overalls on the narrow-metal chair staring out of the door with his elbows propped up under his nose. Leaning beside him, his pet fluffy hamster spins its wheel as he lazily brushes its rough, gray fur. As Steven looks out through the circular-shaped door hinges across the sunlit garden at the zoo, he gives a mischievous grin. Next afternoon, Steven and Mark are early for lunch. A spotted dog is lying on the chef's table. It rolls over as they close the cafeteria gate. Sophie frowns at them approvingly as they tiptoe into the yard. The dog tumbles off of the chair and transforms into Ranger Bill. Earlier, the bright statue of Ranger Tim dances into his bakery. He plants his feet on Jasper who giggles nervously. Steven doodles sloppy doodles. Tim detects him. Sophie elbows Steven. He puts his marker back in the holder. Sophie waves her foot. Sophie guesses. Sophie is eager to question. The tiny shack. Brian stares into a pitcher. Brian's face is smeared with paint. Turtles carrying boxes waddle in through a side hatch. A package is thrown to one of the adults above. The clumsy turtles waddle amongst the painted iron rafters and scuttle from one corner of the tiny shack to the other, tossing boxes and packages to their bored riders. Mark has obtained a novel and some boxes. He kicks the novel to one corner. Steven grabs it. Oliver unwraps a large rubber bat. It turns purple. Sophie watches them both with wide eyes. In the zoo grounds, a messy man with curly golden beard shuffles across the sand. Steven's hat flies straight into his pocket. Jasper grabs his backpack. The others keep yawning. Mark's hat drifts up and knocks him on the toe. Oliver's backpack yanks him into the sand. Horrified he drops even lower. The backpack drags him lower beneath their feet. He flips on for dear life. The backpack flings him around in loops and crashes into the side of a brick fountain. It bounces away just to loop again then rises towards the sky. Grandpa Smith takes out his turtle. The adults scramble. The backpack ropes Oliver, and whizzes up over the pigeons on the shingles. His scarf gets snagged on the kite and he loses the backpack. The vest tears and gives way. He glides up and floats lightly into the sky. His scarf fluttering, Grandpa Smith hops across to Oliver and fiercely shakes him down. Jasper loses the Trailminder. Jasper climbs his backpack. He slides beneath their feet. Steven plops astride his backpack. Steven hides behind Jasper.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: All the boys are asleep except Harry, who sits by the window in his pajamas with his pet owl. Gazing contently across the moonlit school courtyard, he strokes his owl's feathers. The next morning, Harry and Ron are late to class, where Professor McGonagall, initially a cat, transforms in front of them. In Snape's class, Hermione eagerly tries to answer while Harry takes notes. In the great hall, owls deliver mail; Ron receives a newspaper, which Harry picks up, while Neville's glass ball turns red. Outside, students practice with brooms. Harry's broom responds instantly, but others, like Ron and Neville, struggle. Neville loses control, crashes, and falls, but Madam Hooch assists him. Malfoy taunts with the Remembrall, and Harry chases him on his broom.
